agency_desc: Provides community health services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers primary health care, and school/sports/employment exams, disease management, laboratory testing, and immunizations to patients of all ages.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for services or financial needs assessment (if applicable).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides victim assistance and crisis response to both male and female victims of domestic violence, human trafficking, or sexual assault. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. A 24-hour hotline is available to answer questions about domestic violence or sexual assault, assist victims in preparing safety plans, and provide information and referrals to area resources.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence or sexual assault

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - OWEN COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - OWEN COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. Family law only.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - OWEN COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Owen County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply for the waitlist.
site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services in the town of Spencer.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Spencer in Owen County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for all veteran issues, including providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital in Indianapolis, Indiana or to the veterans' clinic in Bloomington, Terre Haute, or Martinsville, Indiana. Vehicle is not wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Minimum of 3 days notice to schedule. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis, Bloomington, Terre Haute, or Martinsville, Indiana
Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_name: GARRARD CHAPEL - GOD PROVIDES FOOD PANTRY
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through
site_eligibility: Living in Owen County -- Not used this pantry within the past 30 days

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance with utilities, rent, prescriptions, transportation, and minor vehicle or furnace repairs to Owen County persons in need. Assistance is provided on a case-by-case basis and is dependent on available funding.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail to request assistance; provide contact information and type of assistance needed.
site_eligibility: Living in Owen County
Open
Living in Owen County -- Not visited within the past 3 months

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
site_name: SPENCER UNITED METHODIST CHURCH - FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Toiletries and cleaning supplies are sometimes available. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open -- Not used this pantry within the past 30 days

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food each week for persons in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit food pantry serving persons in need in Owen County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area. Toiletries are sometimes available.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open -- Not visited this pantry within the past month

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach programs to persons in need.
service_description: Offers to pay the last $50 of a current rent or mortgage payment, past due utility bill, or non-narcotic prescription expenses.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; ask for Salvation Army.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm

site_eligibility: Needing assistance with current rent or mortgage payment, past-due utility bill -OR- non-narcotic prescription -- With proof that only the last $50 is needed -- Not received financial assistance more than twice from this agency within the past year

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in Owen County.
service_description: Offers a dollar-for-dollar match, up to $20, to recipients of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) when purchasing Indiana-grown fresh fruits and vegetables at this farmers market. Qualifying purchases must be made with a Hoosier Works electronic benefit transfer (EBT) card with SNAP benefits.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: With Hoosier Works EBT card with SNAP benefits to pay for purchases
Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers free classes and one-on-one sessions covering a variety of computer skills, including basic computer and Internet skills, Microsoft Office programs, email, and more.
site_details: Call for class schedules or to register.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Computer Classes: Vary -- One-on-one sessions: By appointment

site_schedule.schedule: Information/Registration: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Testing: Call for testing dates.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Tutoring: Tues and Thurs 3pm-6pm; appointments available (Follows the Spencer-Owen community school district)

site_schedule.name: Adult Literacy Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Literacy Tutoring: By appointment only

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Classes: Mon-Thurs 12:30pm-3:30pm and 5:30pm-8:30pm

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Childhood Immunization
site_schedule.schedule: Immunizations: Tues and Fri, by appointment -- Office: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm

site_schedule.name: HPV Immunizations
site_schedule.schedule: Immunizations: Tues and Fri, by appointment -- Office: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm

site_schedule.schedule: Tues and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm, by appointment

site_schedule.name: Adult Immunization
site_schedule.schedule: Immunizations: Tues and Fri, by appointment -- Office: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm

site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Open
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

Varies by service; call for details.

Age 19 or older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Spencer in Owen County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Spencer in Owen County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. -- For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours or call Owen County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit no-kill animal shelter providing adoptions and surrender services.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet supplies, pet food, kitty litter, trash bags, and cleaning supplies for a no-kill animal shelter. Volunteers are welcome.
site_details: Drop off donations during shelter hours. -- Call for information about volunteer opportunities.
site_eligibility: Volunteers: Age 18 and older
To surrender an animal: Living in Owen County -- To adopt an animal: Age 21; applications are screened to ensure suitable homes

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in this county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Owen County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Owen County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 9am; Monthly 3rd Mon 6pm

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 9am; Monthly 3rd Mon 6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, and traffic violations in Owen County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the Court Clerk.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Owen County Circuit Court, including supervising adult and juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.

site_schedule.name: Probation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri 8am-4pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Owen County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Owen County, Circuit Court 2 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or call the County Clerk's office for claim forms or more information.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Owen County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Owen County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Owen County

agency_desc: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Owen County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Owen County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Owen County excluding the town of Gosport

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets in Owen County.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Owen County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers sandbags to Owen County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 -or-Owen County dispatch. -- For sandbags during times of flooding, be prepared to fill and haul sandbags.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Owen County)

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Owen County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers information on abortion alternatives and provides post-abortion support; pregnancy testing; and support for pregnant women and new mothers.
service_description: Counsels women in crisis pregnancies on alternatives to abortion. Provides free pregnancy testing and verification, offers referrals for medical care, adoption, and other abortion alternatives. Provides diapers and formula when available.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open
Expecting or parenting moms, dads, and grandparents raising grandchildren

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Description Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Gosport in Owen County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services, including street and sidewalk maintenance, and groundskeeping of town properties.
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Owen County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service

To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Owen County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody     of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Owen County

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH CARE - SPENCER INTEGRATED HEALTH
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
